meaningMnemonic: This one is a little strange. You have 混じる (to get mixed up in), 混ぜる (to mix), 混ざる (to get mixed), and now this: 混む, <vocabulary>to be crowded</vocabulary>. It makes sense that when everyone's all mixed up it's going to be crowded, but how to differentiate between this and the other 混 words? Just think of how cows <reading>muuuuu</reading> (む) get all bunched up and crowded, which is why this word is <vocabulary>to be crowded</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: Hey, <reading>come</reading> (こむ) out of that crowd of cows. It's going <vocabulary>to be crowded</vocabulary> in there.
